intro: Schizoglossum bidens subsp. pachyglossum, commonly known as the broad-lipped schizoglossum, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its subspecies distinction is based on the broader corolla lobes compared to the typical form. It is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to thrive in well-drained environments.
